intro: Barrotia gaudichaudii, commonly known as the New Caledonia barrotia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
